name: Community Environment Day at Shoppers World Danforth
description:
Join Councillor Bradford (Ward 19) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. This event will take place in the vacant parking lot of the closed Lowes store.

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Spirit Box - The Psychic Experience
description:
Psychic Angel Morgan takes you on a journey through time.

Tradition meets technology, and the choice is yours. What if you could touch the other side? What if you could hear your loved ones one more time? What if there was no wall between the worlds. What if, for just one moment, the other side...was real?

The Spirit Box will open the gates, and open the way, will you cross over?

Using traditional techniques and modern paranormal equipment audiences will not believe their eyes and ears as they hear the voices of the dead.

name: Weaving Futures: Dream Weave Workshop with Blessyl Buan
description:
Participate in a hands-on workshop and contribute your dreams and intentions to a growing tapestry entitled The Dream Weave, led by multidisciplinary artist Blessyl Buan drawing on Filipino weaving traditions.

Use markers, paint and sustainable materials, such as rice bags and dried palm, to express your hopes through hands-on creation. This workshop sets the stage for The Dream Weave to be unveiled as part of Nuit Blanche in North York as an evolving installation and living archive of collective vision and belonging.

Blessyl Buan is a Toronto-born multidisciplinary artist working in dance, painting and fibre. Rooted in her Filipino heritage and guided by kapwa — the interconnectedness of self, nature and the cosmos — her work explores cultural memory, healing and belonging.
